properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:33AM CST until February 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected today.
Total snow accumulations of one to two inches mainly during the
morning hours. Snow should mix with rain during the afternoon.
An arctic front will move through late in the day and light snow
will be possible along the front. Wind gusts of 35 mph will
also be possible late this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills expected tonight. Wind chills as low as
15 below zero.

* WHERE...Jefferson County.

* WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory is in effect until midnight
CST tonight. The Wind Chill Advisory is in effect from midnight
tonight to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold
wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not
taken.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
